output.conclusion: By completing this course, you will have a solid understanding of the Internet of Things, its architecture, key technologies, and security considerations. You will be equipped to design, develop, and deploy IoT solutions in various domains.
output.introduction: Welcome to the Internet of Things (IoT) course designed for intermediate learners. This course builds upon basic IoT concepts and delves into more advanced topics, including IoT architecture, communication protocols, data analytics, security, and practical applications. Each module is designed to take approximately 10 minutes to read.

chapters.description: Explore the layered architecture of IoT systems, including the perception, network, and application layers. Understand the functions and components of each layer.
Dive into common IoT communication protocols such as MQTT, CoAP, and HTTP. Compare their features, advantages, and disadvantages for different IoT applications.
Learn about device management techniques for IoT devices, including provisioning, configuration, monitoring, and remote control.
Understand the role of data analytics in IoT. Learn about data collection, processing, storage, and visualization techniques for IoT data.
Explore the concept of edge computing and its benefits for IoT applications. Learn how to perform data processing and analytics at the edge of the network.

Learn how to integrate IoT devices and data with cloud platforms such as AWS IoT, Azure IoT Hub, and Google Cloud IoT. Understand the benefits of cloud integration for scalability and data management.

modules.moduleTitle: IoT Data Analytics and Cloud Integration

chapters.description: Identify common security threats in IoT systems, including device vulnerabilities, network attacks, and data breaches. Understand the importance of security in IoT.
Learn about security best practices for IoT devices, networks, and data. Implement security measures such as authentication, authorization, encryption, and access control.
Explore IoT security standards and regulations such as GDPR, NIST, and ISO. Understand the compliance requirements for IoT deployments.
